instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023A: What is 820-3023A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light Blinking
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light Blinking on AC

It was liquid damaged. ultrasonic cleaned to get it to turn on. and every is fine 

except... the green light blinks when its plugged in 

changed i/o board and cable 

same thing

if i plug it into another adapter. it works sometimes but greeen doesnt come on instantly. but when it does, it does charge battery

ideas?

TIA

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light Blinking
threads.message: Are the <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>, and <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> pins on the dc in connector nice looking? Do these signals make their way over to the DC in board? What resistance do you get between pins 17/18 and 27/28 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?
